page.title: 08MEDLAR (NEAR GREENHALGH)
page.content: This is a village of contrasts in housing. The farmhouses are hugh and there is also a council housing estate of some 20 red brick tile-roofed houses. Of these, ten are semi-detached and eight are terraced in groups of four, built in red brick with tiled roofs. Some tenants have bought their council homes in recent years. There is one bungalow of a simple design in red brick with a slate roof. Medlar Hall Farm has a very large house, high with large windows, about 150 years old, built of handmade bricks with a slate roof and high brick chimneys. The other fram houses are large about 100 - 150 years old. Most are owner occupied.
